ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.26.1_0: ‘If a monk is difficult to correct in regard to a difficult monk, or he makes himself incorrectly correct by the monks, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.27_0: “Venerables, don’t say anything to me, either good or bad, and I won’t say anything to you, either good or bad;

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.30_0: “Venerable, be easy to correct, not incorrigible.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.56_0: After the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.59_0: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.60_0: He commits an offense entailing suspension:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.61_0: ... Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
